UBd-CKc81ufk4R2d75mMwg.text: This is a hard to find gem! Have eaten Thai food all over the world and this is as good as it gets. Fresh, flavorful and SPICY.  Take out was fast and food was great.  Note google maps and apple maps show the location in a close on the high side of cockburn. It is on the low side in a close. Hard to find but way worth it.

tMpQf_-LWKR8ME-bA2Zf2w.text: I went here for dinner with my family.. i like their chicken satay. The tom yum was okay..the red and panang curry is good..  CONCLUSION = RECOMMENDED!!

OvRxypQapJEtyOG9w21JlA.text: The best Thai food i have ever had. Such a small little place, we were just a bit afraid as it seemed a little sketchy, but we went inside and it was quite warm and welcoming. The food was amazing, we ordered lots of pad thai and also the Krua Khun Mae noodles which were equally as delicious. The customer service was amazing, all around a very great experience and impeccable food. 10/10 would reccomend.

photos.caption: Photo of Krua Khun Mae - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

k6dC09xZdIS5RdBM-iKagg.text: Vegan approved. As a vegan dining in Thai restaurants, I typically go for the vegetarian dishes and ensure that no egg or dairy is added (of course). This restaurant presents as very sensitive to allergies and dietary requirements, with statements on its menu speaking to the care that is taken in ingredient selection and food preparation.  I got the green curry, spicy ("Thai spicy" explained the waiter) and holy moly it was so good. It did not feel at all like I got a white girl version of a Thai spicy dish, it was nice and warm and balanced and delicious. My co-diners got pad Thai and a duck dish, and both were super happy with their meals. I highly recommend this place.

MquVeMDJf53Qmai12nkdiA.text: So good! Asked for my Panang Curry Thai hot and it was hot while keeping all the flavor. Really delicious! It's down an alley and a little hard to find so look for the sign and it'll point you in the right direction! A hidden gem!

8i-3LwOn7lttB2TXHoDSAw.text: This is a hidden place. So difficult to notice, but the pad Thai is one of the best. In my opinion, Pad Thai needs to be dry. It cannot come with excess sauce. the Pad Thai here did a great job

-GCd3RN8sTx5DuU8N78oIw.text: I love this place! It's cute, the waitresses are very friendly, and the food is super flavorful.  There are a few things that could be improved hence the 4 vs. 5 stars. If I could, I would give it closer to five stars. I ordered the crying tiger beef and OMG, meat was very tender and flavorful. The only thing is that it was more over than I would like so if you like your meat the right way, be vocal and tell them otherwise it will come up pretty much rare. The sauce that you can select from are hot (if you order spicy) to mild and are legit. Tons of flavor and Thai spicy level. Husband had a stir fry and it was also great. Another two pet peeves - why rice does not come with the meal you order is unusual so be prepared to pay another 2 GBP for a bowl of rice that cost virtually nothing. Also, refilling water not so often so you'll be flagging the waitress down.

DfE8QrNEx4my7eErZ6mWig.text: This is my favorite thai place that exists, and I've had a lot of pad thai in my life! Krua Khun Mae is hidden down a narrow ally. I liked that it was hidden away from the main street-- it's a total hidden gem. The employees were all very friendly. I had the pad thai, and as mentioned above, it was the best I've ever had and I'm extremely picky about my pad thai... it was so good that I came back a second time during my 3 day visit to Edinburgh.   I will absolutely be back the next time I'm in town-- I dream about this pad thai all the time! SOO GOOD!

g0AXlNnoomgUQZkAW9aMfw.text: Outstanding food - probably one of the best Thai meals I have had in Edinburgh, hence the 5 stars.  The restaurant is located in Old Town, in one of the closes just off Cockburn Street. Given the location, it's a bit of a hidden gem but definitely worth the visit if you're after some tasty Thai food.  They have a good selection of starters, main courses and chef's specials. Also some fusion type dishes are featured, e.g. Khua Khun Mae Special in the starters section, which is traditional Scottish haggis with Thai style seasoning. Sounds interesting, but I went for the deep fried king prawns with Thai beer batter served with a homemade mango sweet sauce. They were lovely - three large morsels with a tasty dipping sauce which wasn't too sweet.   For main course I had a duck stir fry. Again, absolutely delicious - tender and very tasty duck with vegetables. Note that they do ask you how hot you would like your food.  The waitress was very friendly and polite.

photos.caption: Photo of Krua Khun Mae - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Duck stir fry
Photo of Krua Khun Mae - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Deep fried king prawns with mango sweet chilli sauce

8T0jkFYlfrkR_OQN3ueURQ.text: The hottest som tum salad I've ever had! And I loved it!!! In all fairness, they do ask the degree is spiciness you want and I told her to give it me. You could certainly ask for mild or medium. Also had the Penang curry with chicken. Another of my Thai favorites. The place is tiny and nothing really special in terms of atmosphere but the food is really good and service was friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Krua Khun Mae - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken Penang curry
Photo of Krua Khun Mae - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Som tum (green papaya) salad

RLExaT7nKL2Qjj5t6T2cSg.text: The food is good and they are lovely people in there, but unfortunately tonight I found out they only have two vegan options, whereas last time they said all the bean curd dishes could be made vegan, Not the case as they have fish sauce in them, which I unknowingly ate last time. Just thought it was worth noting, it's not as Vegan friendly as I first thought.... however it's still worth a visit for all and the food I had tonight was still nice!

Q77UsMtAWK6g57Dg8MOF0Q.text: Krua Khun Mae is a great spot for getting away from the bustle and bumble of Edinburgh to enjoy a calm, warming Thai meal. Two of us ordered tofu and veg massaman curry and pad pong kha ree (stir-fried chilli paste, turmeric and madras power, egg, coconut milk, celery, carrot, onion, spring onion -- highly recommend) with egg noodles and jasmine rice which was the perfect amount for a hungry couple. It was all 24! Lovely food, kind waitresses and great value.

photos.caption: Photo of Krua Khun Mae - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Massaman curry (tofu &amp; veg)
Photo of Krua Khun Mae - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pad Pong Kha Ree (tofu &amp; veg)

e2FIyr3sWvw83Chk3QbYQg.text: Difficult to find unless you know it's there. This is both a blessing and curse. As not many people will take your spot in this gem of a restaurant, not many people will visit either.  The place is small and any group bigger than 6 will dominate the place. I'd recommend a smaller number in your dinner party 2-4 will be perfect.  As far as Thai dishes go, this has to be it. I did not have to add anything to the meal to spice it up. They have 5 level of hotness and luckily for me I chose a duck with level 4 'Hot' as that was just about right without making my eyes water (too much). Taste is IMO authentic, as far as I can tell authentic from not. Just say; very spicy and pleasingly fragrant. Service was impeccable, very attentive and unobtrusive.   I'd recommend this place to all Thai Luvvahs!

xXbBbvNPioez4Z6oiV0VqQ.text: Hidden location. Excellent food. We waited a long time for our order and our bill. Wait was made excruciating by the background music on a repeating loop we heard at least 15 times during our meal.

DFsBVhMipJSZv3ii1PKu6Q.text: Not recommend. The service and environment are good. However, food are a little bit expensive compared to small sizes they offer. Plus, pad thai is too sweet that I couldn't even taste flavor of lemongrass.

2FvZmxqAxG8xl72qpIVimg.text: It's a totally surprise hidden in a close. Tastes so well. Environment and service is perfect. Absolute Thai experience.
